greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered ways to write n as w^2 + x^2 + y^2 + z^2 with x + 3*y + 5*z a square, where w, x, y and z are nonnegative integers.
comment: (ii) Any integer n > 15 can be written as w^2 + x^2 + y^2 + z^2 with w, x, y, z nonnegative integers and 6*x + 10*y + 12*z a square.

(iii) Each nonnegative integer n not among 7, 15, 23, 71, 97 can be written as w^2 + x^2 + y^2 + z^2 with w, x, y, z nonnegative integers and 2*x + 6*y + 10*z a square. Also, any nonnegative integer n not among 7, 43, 79 can be written as w^2 + x^2 + y^2 + z^2 with w, x, y, z nonnegative integers and 3*x + 5*y + 6*z a square.
See also A271510 and A271513 for related conjectures.
a(n) > 0 verified for all n <= 3*10^7. - _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Nov 28 2016
Qing-Hu Hou at Tianjin Univ. has verified a(n) > 0 and parts (ii) and (iii) of the above conjecture for n up to 10^9. - _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Dec 04 2016
The conjecture that a(n) > 0 for all n = 0,1,2,... is called the 1-3-5-Conjecture and the author has announced a prize of 1350 US dollars for its solution. - _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Jan 17 2017
Qing-Hu Hou has finished his verification of a(n) > 0 for n up to 10^10. - _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Feb 17 2017
The 1-3-5 conjecture was finally proved by António Machiavelo and Nikolaos Tsopanidis in a JNT paper published in 2021. This is a great achivement! - _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Mar 31 2021
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000

António Machiavelo, Rogério Reis, and Nikolaos Tsopanidis, Report on Zhi-Wei Sun's 1-3-5 conjecture and some of its refinements, J. Number Theory 222 (2021), 21-29.
